meanings.definition: A structure or device used to secure something in place.
meanings.sent1: The holdfasts on the wall kept the shelf from falling.
meanings.sent2: The holdfasts on the tent ensured it stayed put during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hang from the holdfasts on the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the holdfasts that kept her dreams anchored in reality.
meanings.sent5: The holdfasts acted like strong glue, firmly holding the pieces together.

meanings.definition: A type of seaweed that attaches itself to rocks or other surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The holdfasts of the seaweed clung tightly to the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: The holdfasts of the kelp kept it firmly in place despite the strong currents.
meanings.sent3: The holdfasts of the seaweed played hide and seek with the fish.
meanings.sent4: The holdfasts of the kelp were like nature's own adhesive, sticking to the rocks.
meanings.sent5: The holdfasts of the seaweed were like tiny anchors, keeping it steady in the water.
